Package com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.tax

Interface TaxJurisdiction

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractTaxJurisdiction, CanadianTaxJurisdiction
public interface TaxJurisdiction
Interface for any tax jurisdiction
Author:
Andrew

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.LinkedHashSet<Tax> getAllTaxes()
    The list of taxes for a given jurisdiction must not contain any duplicate taxes and must be maintained in a particular order, as some taxes may be applied on top of other taxes prior to them on the list e.g., Quebec sales taxes are applied on top of the federal sales tax
    com.ibm.icu.util.Region getRegion()
    Every tax jurisdiction must correspond to a specific geographical region
    TaxableCategory getTaxableCategoryFor​(SellableItem sellableItem)
    TODO: SOLID design principles suggest maybe this shouldn't be here.
    java.util.LinkedHashMap<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> getTaxAmountsFor​(SellableItem sellableItem)  

  • Method Details

    • getRegion

      com.ibm.icu.util.Region getRegion()
      Every tax jurisdiction must correspond to a specific geographical region
      Returns:
      the geographical region corresponding to this jurisdiction

    • getTaxableCategoryFor

      TaxableCategory getTaxableCategoryFor​(SellableItem sellableItem)
      TODO: SOLID design principles suggest maybe this shouldn't be here. If we want to allow simple implementations not to have a category, this should be split out in to another interface again.
      Parameters:
      sellableItem - the item to be sold
      Returns:
      the taxable category for this item in this jurisdiction, null if no category found

    • getAllTaxes

      java.util.LinkedHashSet<Tax> getAllTaxes()
      The list of taxes for a given jurisdiction must not contain any duplicate taxes and must be maintained in a particular order, as some taxes may be applied on top of other taxes prior to them on the list e.g., Quebec sales taxes are applied on top of the federal sales tax
      Returns:
      the ordered set of all taxes for this jurisdiction

    • getTaxAmountsFor

      java.util.LinkedHashMap<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> getTaxAmountsFor​(SellableItem sellableItem)
      Parameters:
      sellableItem - the item to be sold
      Returns:
      a map from each tax for
